# box plotting
```{r, collapse=TRUE}
data("iris")
str(iris)
boxplot(as.list(iris[1:50, 1:4]))
boxplot(Sepal.Length ~ Species, data = iris)
pairs(iris[1:4], main = "Anderson's Iris Data -- 3 species",   pch = 21, 
      bg = c("red", "green3", "blue")[unclass(iris$Species)])
```

# decision tree
```{r}
idx <- sample(2, nrow(iris), replace=TRUE, prob=c(0.7, 0.3))
trainData <- iris[idx==1,]
testData <- iris[idx==2,]

#install.packages("party")
require(party)
formula <- Species ~ Sepal.Length + Sepal.Width + Petal.Length + Petal.Width
iris_ctree <- ctree(formula, data=trainData)
pred <- predict(iris_ctree, testData)
conf.mat <- table(pred, testData$Species)
(accuracy <- sum(diag(conf.mat))/sum(conf.mat) * 100)
plot(iris_ctree)
```

# for statements
```{r}
for (i in 1:10) { print(i) }

i <- 1
repeat {
  print(i)
  if (i >= 10) { break }
  i <- i+1
}

i <- 0
while (i < 10){
  print(i)
  i <- i+1
}

```

# functions
```{r}
fibo <- function(n){
  if (n==1 || n==2) { return(1)}
  else { return(fibo(n-1)+fibo(n-2))}
}

fibo(2)
fibo(10)

f <- function(x, y) { print(x); print(y)}
f(1,2)
x <- c(1,2,3)
y <- c(10, 20, 30)
f(x, y)

g <- function(z, ...){
  print(z)
  f(...)
}

g(1,2,3)

```
